definitions.definition: To place on the sidelines; to bench or to keep someone out of play.
examples: The coach sidelined the player until he regained his strength.

definitions.definition: To remove or keep out of circulation or out of the focus.
examples: The illness sidelined him for weeks.

main_definition: ( sports , transitive ) To place on the sidelines; to bench or to keep someone out of play.
secondary_definitions: ( figurative , transitive ) To remove or keep out of circulation or out of the focus.
